meanings.sent1: My kinsman, Uncle Joe, always tells funny stories at family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: He is my closest kinsman, always there to lend a helping hand when needed.
meanings.sent3: My kinsman challenged me to a silly dance-off at the reunion.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty makes him a kinsman in every sense of the word.
meanings.sent5: The bond between kinsmen is unbreakable, like a chain of love.

meanings.definition: A member of the same family
meanings.sent1: My kinsman, Aunt Mary, is known for her delicious apple pie.
meanings.sent2: We are all kinsmen here, sharing both laughter and tears.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kinsman hid all the cookies before the family party.
meanings.sent4: In this close-knit community, everyone is a kinsman to one another.
meanings.sent5: The family reunion brought together kinsmen from near and far.

meanings.definition: A person of the same nationality or ethnic group
meanings.sent1: As a kinsman from the same country, we share a deep understanding of our traditions.
meanings.sent2: He greeted me warmly, recognizing me as a fellow kinsman from his homeland.
meanings.sent3: The kinsman from the neighboring village always tells the best jokes.
meanings.sent4: In a foreign land, finding a kinsman brings a sense of comfort and familiarity.
meanings.sent5: The bond between kinsmen of the same ethnicity is like a bridge connecting hearts.
